it was a great description of the course and basic step by step well detailed. Anyone who is a beginner could understand easily apply this knowledge.
in my own opinion, it could do better to review practices just a thought.

results.content: This is a great course for the beginner of Laravel. The course does require a good OOP/PHP understanding. This is not a course for the PHP beginner in my opinion. When I did have issues with my code, I was able to figure it out on my own due to the thoroughness of the instructor. When taking on a framework like this you should be at a point where you don't require any hand holding, because it looks like your questions will not be answered soon, looks like you are on your own here. The course moves along at a medium to fast pace, not too slow, not too fast. The instructor does an excellent job of explaining why you are doing things. The instructor leaves the application very usable, but incomplete for the student to complete as an exercise of the newly acquired knowledge, I like this approach. The final project is a very good real world example that you can use to store your own Q & A, but wait until the end of the course before entering a bunch of data.  I learned a lot and highly recommend this course and this instructor!

results.content: I've wanted to learn Laravel for a while to build on my PHP knowledge and have tried a few courses, but most of them have not really engaged with my learning style... however this one has! Really confident, enthusiastic teacher and his in-depth knowledge of the subject shines through in every lesson. If you have the foundations of PHP, and need to take your learning to framework level, using Laravel in particular, then this is the course to take.
results.content_html: I've wanted to learn Laravel for a while to build on my PHP knowledge and have tried a few courses, but most of them have not really engaged with my learning style... however this one has! Really confident, enthusiastic teacher and his in-depth knowledge of the subject shines through in every lesson. If you have the foundations of PHP, and need to take your learning to framework level, using Laravel in particular, then this is the course to take.

results.content:
This course covers the latest version of Laravel, which is refreshing. The instructor is clear and very efficient in his explanations. The choice of material is exactly what I was looking for: pragmatic and to the point. 

Usually I don't review courses until I get to the finishing line. In this case, I'm reviewing it earlier for several reasons: the course is new (and a good one), and this is not one of those Packt video courses with an actor reading the material; this is "the real thing" and it makes a huge difference.

To put things in perspective about my review, I'm (or was) enrolled in other Laravel courses, which for one reason or another I left behind. Also, I'm an older Udemy customer with close to 200 courses in my library. That is the reason why I'm very happy to find an up-to-date Laravel course as good as this one.

NOTES:
There were no Laravel installation instructions on the first section. That wasn't a big deal since Laravel's site has clear steps for its installation. I'm creating my projects inside of Xampp, in the htdocs folder, which runs on PHP 7.1. So far, I haven't had a problem. Just make sure Apache is on when creating a new project or you may have some errors due to PHP absence.

This course covers the latest version of Laravel, which is refreshing. The instructor is clear and very efficient in his explanations. The choice of material is exactly what I was looking for: pragmatic and to the point.

Usually I don't review courses until I get to the finishing line. In this case, I'm reviewing it earlier for several reasons: the course is new (and a good one), and this is not one of those Packt video courses with an actor reading the material; this is "the real thing" and it makes a huge difference.

To put things in perspective about my review, I'm (or was) enrolled in other Laravel courses, which for one reason or another I left behind. Also, I'm an older Udemy customer with close to 200 courses in my library. That is the reason why I'm very happy to find an up-to-date Laravel course as good as this one.

NOTES:
There were no Laravel installation instructions on the first section. That wasn't a big deal since Laravel's site has clear steps for its installation. I'm creating my projects inside of Xampp, in the htdocs folder, which runs on PHP 7.1. So far, I haven't had a problem. Just make sure Apache is on when creating a new project or you may have some errors due to PHP absence.
